clinical_study.brief_title: A Comparison of Video Laryngoscopes and the Direct Laryngoscope in Simulated Normal and Difficult Infant Airway.
clinical_study.official_title: A Comparison of the Novel King Vision Pediatric aBlade and the C-MAC Video Laryngoscope to the Direct Laryngoscope in Simulated Normal and Difficult Infant Airway. A Bicentric, Prospective, Randomized Manikin Study

brief_summary.textblock: In Pediatric both manikin and human studies have suggested that the video laryngoscopy is equally suitable to facilitate intubation compared to the direct laryngoscopy.

detailed_description.textblock: The King Vision Pediatric aBlade is a novel video laryngoscopy for securing the airway of new born and infants. In this manikin studie we want to compare different types of video laryngoscopes in a simulated normal and difficult infant airway.

study_design_info.masking_description: residents, fellows and attending with different level of experience

primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed intraoperatively at time of intubation (seconds)
primary_outcome.description: Three timepoints will be recorded, beginning with the insertion of the device past the theeth/gum into the mouth. These will inlcude time to best view, time to removal of device from the mouth, and the time to the first chest raising of the simulator

secondary_outcome.measure: First attempt success rate of tracheal intubation (in 40 seconds)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed intraoperatively at time of intubation
secondary_outcome.description: An attempt at tracheal intubation will be defined as entry of the device into the patient's mouth without the need to remove the device once entered and securing the airway.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed intraoperatively at time of intubation
secondary_outcome.description: Cormack&Lehane Grade (1-4) and percentage of glottic opening (POGO) (%) will be recorded after insertion of the laryngoscope

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed intraoperatively at time of intubation
secondary_outcome.description: BURP or change the head/Shoulder position to optimised the glottic view will be recorded
Airway manipulations utilized and ease of use (Likert 1-5) will be assessed by the user following the intubation.

arm_group.description: Time (normal airway) using the novel King Vision™ Pediatric aBlade (KV) video laryngoscope, C-MAC™ D-blade Ped (DP), C-MAC™ Miller Blade (MB), shortened as VL, compared with conventional direct laryngoscopy (DL)

Time (difficult airway) using the novel King Vision™ Pediatric aBlade (KV) video laryngoscope, C-MAC™ D-blade Ped (DP), C-MAC™ Miller Blade (MB), shortened as VL, compared with conventional direct laryngoscopy (DL)

intervention.description: The Time interval between the laryngoscope blade passing the teeth/gums to the announcing of the first ventilation was recorded as the time to ventilation with the Video laryngoscopy (VL) or conventional direct laryngoscopy (DL)

The Time interval between the laryngoscope blade passing the teeth/gums to the announcing of the first ventilation was recorded as the time to ventilation with the Video laryngoscopy (VL) or conventional direct laryngoscopy (DL)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- anesthesiologists or neonatal/pediatric intensive care medicice specialists with experience in securing pediatric airway
Exclusion Criteria:
- participants without experience in pediatric airway management
